purpose: To outline the strategic planning activities for a card account acquisition program.
title: Strategic planning encompasses the range of activities to design, execute and track a card account acquisition program
reasoning_strategy: The slide presents a structured table to detail activities, descriptions, and leading practices.

tables.description: Table outlining strategic planning activities and their descriptions and remarks.

cells:
Define type of acquisition:
• Existing Customer (Cross-Sell) vs. Open Market
• Pre-Approved vs Invitation to Apply

• Expanding relationship to include credit cards improves overall customer retention
• Card as a first relationship can be a lead generator to build a financial services relationship
• Cross-sell should be considered a primary strategy when an issuer has an established customer base with strong relationships via other financial products
• Construct comprehensive and holistic marketing plans addressing the acquisition objectives
• Set clear goals on the number of accounts to be obtained, channels to acquire customers and the level of account activity desired

rows.row_label: Decide on channel mix and product allocations
cells: • Impactful creatives and messages need to be communicated via a sequence of effective communication channels
• Communicating to the customer via channels they have a preference for will improve the response rate

rows.row_label: Define Key Performance Indicators/ Apply test & control methodology
cells: • Assess performance based on actual customer engagement and activation
• Measurement of the Cost Per Account and the Cost Per Active Account are critical to monitor the effectiveness of acquisition channels, offers, etc.
